text: Patients assigned to robotic therapy had significantly greater improvements in motor function in the affected arm over the course of the study as measured by FMA-UE than did those assigned to conventional therapy ( F = 4.1 , p = 0.041 ; mean difference in score 0.78 points , 95 % CI 0.03-1 .53 ) .
Both treatment modalities were successful in reducing AKs number ( p < .001 ) .
Baseline alcohol problems were associated with some poorer long-term outcomes , but this was evident across CALM and usual care .
The best effect was observed in relation to anxiety .
